item.title: Report from the Kona 2023 ISO C++ Committee meeting
item.author: mpusz
item.description:
Report from the Kona 2023 ISO C++ Committee meeting

Several groups in the ISO C++ Committee reviewed the P1935: A C++ Approach to Physical Unitsproposal in Belfast 2019 and Prague 2020. All those groups expressed interest in the potentialstandardization of such a library and encouraged further work. The authors also got valuableinitial feedback that highly influenced the design of the V2 version of the mp-units library.

In the following years, we scoped on getting more feedback from the production and design anddeveloped version 2 of the mp-units library that resolves many issues raised by the users andCommittee members. The features and interfaces of this version are close to being the best we canget with the current version of the C++ language standard.

item.title: What's new in mp-units 2.0?
item.author: mpusz
item.description:
What's new in mp-units 2.0?

After a year of hard work, we've just released mp-units 2.0.0. It can be obtained fromGitHub andConan.

In this post, we will describe all the changes introduced by the new version.
